pt: {sc}encourage{/sc} {sc}inspirit{/sc} {sc}hearten{/sc} {sc}embolden{/sc} mean to fill with courage or strength of purpose. {sc}encourage{/sc} suggests the raising of one's confidence especially by an external agency.

pt.t: the teacher's praise {it}encouraged{/it} the students to greater efforts

pt: {sc}inspirit{/sc}, somewhat literary, implies instilling life, energy, courage, or vigor into something.
{sc}hearten{/sc} implies the lifting of dispiritedness or despondency by an infusion of fresh courage or zeal.

pt.t: a hospital patient {it}heartened{/it} by good news

pt: {sc}embolden{/sc} implies the giving of courage sufficient to overcome timidity or reluctance.

pt.t: {it}emboldened{/it} by her first success, she tried an even more difficult climb
